intro: Pyrus leighensis, commonly known as the Chinese white pear, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its white flowers and edible, sweet fruit. The tree typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has simple, alternate leaves with serrated margins. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental and fruit-bearing plant in temperate climates. The fruit is often used in traditional Chinese medicine and culinary practices.
